results.title: The World of animals: insects in a garden
results.creator_credit: William Kay and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Uses time lapse and photomicrography to study various insects on a rose bush - aphids, ants, lacewings, and ladybird beetles. Illustrates states in the life cycle of insects; complete metamorphosis in the lacewing and ladybird beetle and incomplete metamorphosis in the aphid. Shows close-up views of ants protecting aphids from ladybird beetles.

results.title: Insects: how to recognise them
results.brief_description: Compares similarities and differences among insects in major groups. Differentiates between insects and other animals and shows the developmental stages through which insects pass from egg to adult. Shows parts of insects and briefly describes their functions. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Insect zoo [col]
results.brief_description: Two children make an insect zoo in their yard. By close-up photography several insects are distinguished and simple homes in which they can be kept are shown.

results.title: Insect tissue culture
results.creator_credit: Alice O'Donnell, David Corke and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Techniques for the tissue culture of cells from insects are shown and various features of the growth of the cells analysed, before and after infection with a polyhedral virus disease.

results.title: Insect life cycle: the periodical cicada. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the Periodical Cicada. The camera traces it from egg-laying, through the years underground, and the emergence from the nymph state, to the mating of the mature adult. Time-lapse photography is used to show a nymph emerging, and the process that follows to development of the wings of a mature adult.
results.title_for_label: Insect life cycle: the periodical cicada. - 2nd ed.
results.description: The life cycle of the Periodical Cicada. results.title: Insect lab
results.brief_description: How scientists at the Insect Pathology Laboratory of the federal Department of Agriculture produce a virus which kills the pine sawfly. Narrated by Julian Biggs.

results.title: Insect foods
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling and Pat Dowling Pictures
results.brief_description: The purpose of this film is to show what and how insects eat, and to illustrate how the feeding habits of insects affect man. Shows clearly the feeding habits of certain insects. Could stimulate further discussion and interest and may kindle the enthusiasm of young people to aim at a career in entomology.

results.title: Insect collecting
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling and Pat Dowling Pictures
results.brief_description: How an insect collection can be established. Representative terrestial and aquatic insects are studied in extreme close-up photography, collecting methods shown include netting, beating host plants, night collecting, investigating dead trees, using the Beriese funnel to procure microscopic speciments, and aquatic methods.
